_prev_prog_3.MH_OtherType: human factors, overheating, loss of flow
_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: deluge system, isolation valves, fail close valves, flammable disconnects
_prev_prog_3.MS_OtherType: fail close valves, flammable disconnect, backflow prevention, isolation valves

_prev_prog_3.Description:
All prevention noted in submission apply to covered process.

Air Liquide?s TI Boulevard location utilizes the following accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:
a) ?management of change? to ensure the covered process is not altered without a safety review
b) gauges and internal piping to ensure the bulk tank contains a maximum of 85% capacity
c) overpressure relief valve on the top of the tank
d) backflow prevention on the fill line
e) fail-closed emergency shut-off valves (Valves are held open by propane backpressure delivered through a consumable tubing system. The tubing will burn in case of fire, isolating the tank.)
f) liquid level rate-of-change alarm on bulk tank
g) relief valves on the pump piping
h) process alarms and interlocks in the downstream processes, sensitive to: flows, steam to carbon ratios, pressures, temperatures, and levels
i) manual emergency shutdown system
j) nearby water cannons (commonly called monitors)
k) area electrical classification and conforming equipment and ground striping
l) backup power
m) 24 hr/day operations supervision
n) operator training to ensure correct operating procedure (SOP)
o) deluge system on bulk tank
p) safety training 
q) manual isolation valves
to safeguard the system, ensure a safe range of operation, and actively mitigate events that fall outside of those parameters.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan executive summary to comply with 40 CRF ? 68.155 as amended by [61 FR 31726, June 20, 1996, as amended at 69 FR 18831, Apr. 9, 2004].

Location: Air Liquide Electronics US LP, 13140 T I Blvd, Dallas, TX

The primary function of the facility at 13140 T I Blvd is to supply bulk gasses (Nitrogen, Oxygen, Argon and Hydrogen) to our customer via pipeline on a 24 hour, 365-day basis. The facility accomplishes this by separating constituent gasses of the atmosphere, Nitrogen, Oxygen and Argon by process of distillation. The facility manufactures Hydrogen by process of catalytic reformation.

During the process of manufacturing Hydrogen, Propane is combined with steam at high temperatures, which causes a reaction releasing Hydrogen. The Propane is chemically changed, not burned. 

The stationary source located at 13140 TI Blvd, Dallas, TX, includes a 18,000 gallon (single wall, vertical) tank of flammable gas and additional flammable gases within the process.

The chemical specific accidental release and accident prevention steps are those to mitigate risk from flammable gases.

This facility complies with EPA?s accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standard, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The covered bulk tank was designed / installed and is maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.

Air Liquide?s TI Boulevard location utilizes the following accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source:
a) ?management of change? to ensure the covered process is not altered without a safety review
b) gauges and internal piping to ensure the bulk tank contains a maximum of 85% capacity
c) overpressure relief valve on the top of the tank
d) backflow prevention on the fill line
e) fail-closed emergency shut-off valves (Valves are held open by propane backpressure delivered through a consumable tubing system. The tubing will burn in case of fire, isolating the tank.)
f) liquid level rate-of-cha

nge alarm on bulk tank
g) relief valves on the pump piping
h) process alarms and interlocks in the downstream processes, sensitive to: flows, steam to carbon ratios, pressures, temperatures, and levels
i) manual emergency shutdown system
j) nearby water cannons (commonly called monitors)
k) area electrical classification and conforming equipment and ground striping
l) backup power
m) 24 hr/day operations supervision
n) operator training to ensure correct operating procedure (SOP)
o) deluge system on bulk tank
p) safety training 
q) manual isolation valves
to safeguard the system, ensure a safe range of operation, and actively mitigate events that fall outside of those parameters.

Air Liquide?s TI Boulevard location has never had an accident involving propane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

Air Liquide?s TI Boulevard location utilizes an Emergency Action Plan, Emergency Response, Standard Operating Procedures (SOP?s), and operator training to ensure personnel are trained to identify and respond to accident and emergency situations.

Air Liquide?s TI Boulevard location emergency response to accidental releases from the covered process includes 
notification of local fire department by telephone
notification of DART by telephone
stopping equipment and isolating any equipment which may leak flammable gases.
isolation of bulk tank via remote levers


Planned changes to improve safety:
As is our policy at Air Liquide, we continue to review our process(es) for possibilities of improvement to process, operational methods, and new technology to lower risk. In conclusion to our most recent Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), Air Liquide?s TI Boulevard location plans to:
1.Verify sizing on a pressure relief valve near a heat exchanger (PSV-623) to ensure sized for high steam flow (D. McQuistion to assign)
2.Review existing procedures pertaining to hot work areas and investigate if improvements are necessary. (D

. McQuistion to assign)
3.Review classified area signage and hazard area identifications and determine if improvements are necessary. (D. McQuistion to assign)
4.Consider adding a check valve between the Hydrogen to Argon injection point and the first block valve (downstream of FE-660). (D. McQuistion to assign)
5. Investigate whether computer based modeling is required or necessary and if it could be beneficial for review of safety systems. (M. Eldridge to complete recommendations by 1/1/08).
6. Review need for a fire water monitor to cover the trailer clean-out area. (D. McQuistion to assign)
7. Review and update the electrical classification drawing. (V. To to complete recommendations by 1/1/08).
8. Relocation of safety relief vent locations which are located within five feet of obstructions.
to improve our process to be implemented by January 1, 2008.
